intro: Oreocarya hispidissima, commonly known as the roughleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It has a taproot system and produces seeds with feathery pappi for wind dispersal. Oreocarya hispidissima is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and plains.
